conclusion: The problem involves a well with a depth of 8 m and a circular wellhead radius of 0.5 m filled with water. The refractive index of water is n=4/3. A frog at the bottom wants to see all the scenery outside the well.
The image shows a frog at the bottom of the well with light rays refracting at an angle C at the water surface.
The critical angle C can be found using Snell's Law: sin(C) = sin(90°)/n.
The farthest distance h from the frog to the wellhead water surface can be calculated using h = r/tan(C).
